00015  * Creates RX packet type

00017 Pkt::Pkt() {
00018         last_error=0;
00019         sz=0;
00020         buf=NULL;
00021         tbuf=NULL;
00022 }//

00024 Pkt::~Pkt() {
00025 
00026         if (NULL!=buf)
00027                 free(buf);
00028 
00029         if (NULL!=tbuf)
00030                 ei_x_free(tbuf);
00031 
00032 }//

00034 ei_x_buff *
00035 Pkt::getTxBuf(void) {
00036 
00037         if (NULL==tbuf) {
00038                 tbuf = (ei_x_buff *) malloc(sizeof(ei_x_buff));
00039         }
00040 
00041         if (NULL==tbuf) {
00042                 last_error = EEPAPI_MALLOC;
00043                 return NULL;
00044         }
00045 
00046         return tbuf;
00047 }//

00049 unsigned char *
00050 Pkt::getBuf(void) {
00051 
00052         return getBuf(Pkt::DSZ);
00053 }//
00054 
00055 unsigned char *
00056 Pkt::getBuf(int size) {
00057 
00058         //allocate minimum size
00059         //for efficiency's sake
00060         if (NULL==buf) {
00061                 if (size<Pkt::DSZ) {
00062                         buf = (char *) malloc(Pkt::DSZ);
00063                         sz = Pkt::DSZ;
00064                 } else {
00065                         buf = (char *) malloc(size);
00066                         sz = size;
00067                 }
00068         }
00069 
00070         if (NULL==buf) {
00071                 sz = 0;
00072                 last_error = EEPAPI_MALLOC;
00073                 return NULL;
00074         }
00075 
00076         //requested size fits the
00077         //current size? else realloc
00078         unsigned char *tmp;
00079         if (size>sz) {
00080                 tmp = (unsigned char *) realloc(buf, size);
00081                 if (NULL!=tmp) {
00082                         sz = size;
00083                         buf=(char *)tmp;
00084                 } else {
00085                         last_error = EEPAPI_REALLOC;
00086                 }
00087         }
00088         return (unsigned char *)buf;
00089 }//

00105 PktHandler::PktHandler() {
00106         last_error=0;
00107         ifd = 0; //usually stdin
00108         ofd = 1; //usually stdout
00109 }//

00114         ofd = _ofd;
00115 }

00121 /**
00122  * Waits for 'len' bytes from
00123  * the input pipe
00124  *
00125  * @return >=0 len retrieved
00126  * @return <0  ERROR eg. EPIPE
00127  * @return 0   ERROR / EOF
00128  */
00129 int
00130 PktHandler::rx_exact(Pkt **p, int len) {
00131 
00132         unsigned char *buf;
00133         buf=(*p)->getBuf(len);
00134 
00135         int i, got=0;
00136 
00137         do {
00138                 if ((i = read(ifd, buf+got, len-got)) <= 0) {
00139                         return i;
00140                 }
00141                 got += i;
00142         } while (got<len);
00143 
00144         return len;
00145 }//
00146 
00147 /**
00148  * Waits for a complete packet
00149  *
00150  * @return 0 SUCCESS
00151  * @return 1 FAILURE
00152  */
00153 int
00154 PktHandler::rx(Pkt **p) {
00155 
00156         //read length field first
00157         int result=PktHandler::rx_exact(p, 2);
00158         if (result<=0) {
00159                 DBGLOG(LOG_ERR,"PktHandler::rx - ERROR reading length field in header");
00160                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO; //check errno
00161                 return 1;
00162         }
00163 
00164         // length field on 2bytes format
00165         unsigned char (*buf)[] = (unsigned char (*)[])(*p)->getBuf();
00166         int l = ((*buf)[0] << 8) | (*buf)[1];
00167 
00168         DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "PktHandler::rx - header len[%i]", l);
00169 
00170         // the packet length gave us
00171         // the information we needed
00172         // to extract the right count
00173         // of bytes from the pipe
00174         result = PktHandler::rx_exact(p, l);
00175         if (result<=0) {
00176                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00177                 return 1;
00178         }
00179 
00180         (*p)->setLength( result );
00181         DBGLOG(LOG_INFO,"PktHandler::rx - got [%i] bytes", result);
00182 
00183         return 0;
00184 }//
00185

00187 /**
00188  * Transmits a packet
00189  *
00190  * @return 0 SUCCESS
00191  * @return 1 FAILURE
00192  */
00193 int
00194 PktHandler::tx(Pkt *p) {
00195 
00196         ei_x_buff *buf = p->getTxBuf();
00197         unsigned char li;
00198 
00199         int result;
00200 
00201         //write packet length on 2bytes
00202         //=============================
00203         li = (buf->index >> 8) & 0xff;
00204         result = PktHandler::tx_exact((char *)&li, 1);
00205         if (result<=0) {
00206                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00207                 return 1;
00208         }
00209 
00210         li = (buf->index) & 0xff;
00211         result = PktHandler::tx_exact((char *)&li, 1);
00212         if (result<=0) {
00213                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00214                 return 1;
00215         }
00216 
00217         // write packet body
00218         result = PktHandler::tx_exact(buf->buff, buf->index);
00219         if (result<=0) {
00220                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00221                 return 1;
00222         }
00223 
00224         //result = fsync(ofd);
00225         //if (0==result) {
00226         //      last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00227         //      return 1;
00228         //}
00229 
00230         return 0;
00231 }//
00232 
00233 int
00234 PktHandler::tx_exact(char *buf, int len) {
00235 
00236         int i, wrote = 0;
00237 
00238         do {
00239                 if ((i = write(ofd, buf+wrote, len-wrote)) <= 0)
00240                         return i;
00241                 wrote += i;
00242         } while (wrote<len);
00243 
00244         return len;
00245 }//
